intro: Dimetopia preissii, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits. It is well adapted to various soil types and can thrive in full sun. Dimetopia preissii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is a symbol of Australian biodiversity.
